title: I'm Having Ping Issues
body: For the past couple days I've been having problems in League, and only in League. My internet is fine, but within League itself my ping has been shooting up to 13K and I have lost ranked games because of this and probably have also gotten reported as well. I have no idea what could be causing this, and to cause even more confusion I played some ARAM's this morning and it behaved relatively fine but it's still higher than my normal 40-45. Anyone have any ideas because the game is starting to get unplayable.

replies.body: Would having an issue with Port 21 cause ping problems? That's the only thing wrong I found.

High latency to a server is often caused by issues along network routing to the server. Sometimes there are local network settings that can impact your connection too, so the guide that *Rineyy* linked is a good place to start. 

If you continue to see high latency after working through that guide, please let me know.

I can't even smurf anymore since Riot's servers are all fucked up. They won't fix it. Instead, they'll blame your ISP and link you the connection issues page. I'd advise you play Dota. A game where they take pride in their work.

The stability issues experienced early this morning have been fixed and the login issues with Century Link ISP users is being worked on.

If you're still experiencing issues, follow the article I linked if you haven't already performed the steps listed in it. If you have already performed them and still experiencing issues, let us know.

Odd that you're only experiencing this in ranked matches. I'd like you to [troubleshoot your high ping.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) and test afterwards in a TT or SR custom game. If your ping looks fine, test in TT or SR normal game and if it's fine there as well, you can proceed to TT or SR ranked. 

If your high ping reappears, let us know.
